title: Function Model Selection - applying a regression

content.question: <math alttext="negative 2"><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math><math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math><math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math><math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math><math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math><math alttext="17"><mn>17</mn></math><math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math><math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math><math alttext="22"><mn>22</mn></math> Model typePredicted value at <math alttext="x equals 2.5"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.5</mn></math><math alttext="C open parentheses x close parentheses equals a x cubed plus b x squared plus c x plus d"><mi>C</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi></math><math alttext="9.125"><mn>9.125</mn></math><math alttext="Q open parentheses x close parentheses equals a x squared plus b x plus c"><mi>Q</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></math><math alttext="10.636"><mn>10.636</mn></math><math alttext="L open parentheses x close parentheses equals a x plus b"><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math><math alttext="11.697"><mn>11.697</mn></math><math alttext="K open parentheses x close parentheses equals a"><mi>K</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi></math><math alttext="10.250"><mn>10.250</mn></math> ​The first table gives the coordinates of four points in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane. The second table gives different function model types and the corresponding predicted value at <math alttext="x equals 2.5"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.5</mn></math> for a best-fit function of that type. The graph of one of the function models in the table passes through all four points. What is the predicted value at <math alttext="x equals 2.5"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.5</mn></math> for this function? (Note: <math alttext="a"><mi>a</mi></math>, <math alttext="b"><mi>b</mi></math>, <math alttext="c"><mi>c</mi></math>, and <math alttext="d"><mi>d</mi></math> represent different real numbers for each model type.)

topic.text: 1.13: Function Model Selection and Assumption Articulation

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
